name: D&D 5e Basic Rules
description: Core combat and skill rules for D&D 5th Edition

combat.name: Attack Roll
combat.description: To make an attack roll, roll a d20 and add your attack modifier.

combat.name: Damage Roll
combat.description: Roll the weapon's damage dice and add your ability modifier.

combat.name: Armor Class
combat.description: To hit a target, your attack roll must equal or exceed their AC.

combat.name: Critical Hit
combat.description: When you roll a natural 20, you score a critical hit. Roll all damage dice twice.

combat.name: Critical Miss
combat.description: When you roll a natural 1, you automatically miss.

skills.name: Ability Check
skills.description: Roll a d20 and add the relevant ability modifier.

skills.name: Skill Check
skills.description: Roll a d20 and add your ability modifier and proficiency bonus if proficient.

skills.name: Saving Throw
skills.description: Roll a d20 and add the relevant ability modifier and proficiency bonus if proficient.

skills.name: Advantage
skills.description: Roll two d20s and use the higher result.

skills.name: Disadvantage
skills.description: Roll two d20s and use the lower result.

spells.name: Spell Attack
spells.description: Roll a d20 and add your spellcasting ability modifier and proficiency bonus.

spells.name: Spell Save DC
spells.description: Targets must make a saving throw against your spell save DC.

spells.name: Spell Damage
spells.description: Roll the spell's damage dice. Add ability modifier only if specified.

spells.name: Concentration
spells.description: When you take damage while concentrating, make a Constitution saving throw (DC 10 or half damage, whichever is higher).
